title: Kamben Geringsing (ceremonial Cloth), 19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: tied resist patterning in warp and weft (double ikat) on plain weave
description: Cotton textile created in the double ikat  or 'geringsing' technique showing a "kota-mesir" pattern (four-pointed star, notched internal pattern, divides piece into semi-circular segments). Semi-circles depict "wayang patlikur isi" motif (geometric wayang figure) and other figures. Wide border at end with geometric pattern. Design in tan on black. Fringed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Kamben Geringsing (ceremonial Cloth), 19th century.Medium: cotton
Technique: tied resist patterning in warp and weft (double ikat) on plain weave. 1961-115-37.
